channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: US Court Extends Detention Of Pro-Palestinian Protest Leader Mahmoud Khalil

media:content.media:description: Mahmoud Khalil was arrested by immigration agents in Manhattan on March 8.

item.description: A U.S. judge on Friday denied Mahmoud Khalil's request to be released from detention, after federal prosecutors changed their rationale for holding the Columbia graduate student as part of its crackdown on pro-Palestinian activists.
item.content:encoded: A U.S. judge on Friday denied Mahmoud Khalil's request to be released from detention, after federal prosecutors changed their rationale for holding the Columbia graduate student as part of its crackdown on pro-Palestinian activists.

item.title: As Israel Strikes Twice In Under 24 Hours, Iran Fires Barrage Of Missiles

media:content.media:description: Israel intercepts a barrage of Iranian missiles after it launched a fresh wave of attacks on Tehran

item.description: Tehran has retaliated by firing a barrage of missiles after Israel launched a second offensive against Iran less than 24 hours since the first. Israel said it has hit more than 200 targets.
item.content:encoded: <iframe title="Player" class="head-story__img img__full lazyload" height="300" scrolling=no frameborder=no src="about:blank" data-src="https://www.ndtv.com/video/embed-player/id/952341/play-via-app-wap?pWidth=100&pHeight=100&embed_type=story&site=classic&autostart=1"> </iframe>Tehran has retaliated by firing a barrage of missiles after Israel launched a second offensive against Iran less than 24 hours since the first. Israel said it has hit more than 200 targets.

item.title: "Iran's Armed Forces Are Ready", Says Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei

media:content.media:description: Khamenei said that all the officials in the country are on the side of the armed forces

item.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Saturday said that Iran's armed forces were ready to face Israel.
item.content:encoded: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Saturday said that Iran's armed forces were ready to face Israel.

item.title: India Demands Bangladesh "Rein In Terrorists" After Tagore's Home Vandalised

media:content.media:description: Kutcherybari, Rabindranath Tagore's ancestral home in Bangladesh, was vandalised by a mob.

item.description: India has strongly condemned the "despicable" and "disgraceful" act of violence and vandalism on poet, polymath, and Nobel laureate Rabindranath Tagore's ancestral home in Bangladesh, describing the perpetrators of the act as "terrorists".
item.content:encoded: India has strongly condemned the "despicable" and "disgraceful" act of violence and vandalism on poet, polymath, and Nobel laureate Rabindranath Tagore's ancestral home in Bangladesh, describing the perpetrators of the act as "terrorists".

item.title: Israel Says It Foiled Iran's '3-Point Plan', Gives Tehran A History Lesson

media:content.media:description: Israeli Ambassador Reuven Azar said that Iran was very close to acquiring a nuclear bomb.

item.description: Iran has no option but to give up their quest to acquire a nuclear weapon and come to the table with clean hands to pursue a peaceful and responsible future, said Israel's Ambassador Reuven Azar.
item.content:encoded: <iframe title="Player" class="head-story__img img__full lazyload" height="300" scrolling=no frameborder=no src="about:blank" data-src="https://www.ndtv.com/video/embed-player/id/952158/play-via-app-wap?pWidth=100&pHeight=100&embed_type=story&site=classic&autostart=1"> </iframe>Iran has no option but to give up their quest to acquire a nuclear weapon and come to the table with clean hands to pursue a peaceful and responsible future, said Israel's Ambassador Reuven Azar.

item.title: Iran's Above-Ground Enrichment Plant At Natanz Destroyed: UN Nuclear Watchdog

media:content.media:description: A building stands damaged in the aftermath of Israeli strikes, in Tehran, Iran, June 13, 2025.

item.description: The above-ground pilot enrichment plant at Iran's Natanz nuclear site has been destroyed, U.N. nuclear watchdog chief Rafael Grossi told a meeting of the U.N. Security Council on Friday on Israel's strikes on Iran.
item.content:encoded: The above-ground pilot enrichment plant at Iran's Natanz nuclear site has been destroyed, U.N. nuclear watchdog chief Rafael Grossi told a meeting of the U.N. Security Council on Friday on Israel's strikes on Iran.

item.title: US Helping Israel Intercept Iranian Missiles: Report

media:content.media:description: US military has helped shoot down Iranian missiles that were headed toward Israel, US officials said.

item.description: The U.S. military has helped shoot down Iranian missiles that were headed toward Israel, two U.S. officials said on Friday.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. military has helped shoot down Iranian missiles that were headed toward Israel, two U.S. officials said on Friday.

item.title: Middle East Airspace Shut After Israel Strikes Iran, Airlines Cancel Flights

media:content.media:description: Tel Aviv's Ben Gurion Airport was closed and Israel's air defence units stood on high alert.

item.description: Airlines steered clear of much of the Middle East on Friday after Israeli attacks on Iranian sites forced carriers to cancel or divert thousands of flights in the latest upheaval to travel in the region.
item.content:encoded: Airlines steered clear of much of the Middle East on Friday after Israeli attacks on Iranian sites forced carriers to cancel or divert thousands of flights in the latest upheaval to travel in the region.

item.title: Macron Says Iran Destabilised Region, France Will Defend Israel

media:content.media:description: "Iran bears a very heavy responsibility for the destabilisation of the region," Macron said.

item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Friday that Iran bore a heavy responsibility for destabilisation of the Middle East and that it had pushed ahead with an unjustified nuclear programme, but he also urged restraint after Israel struck Iran.
item.content:encoded: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Friday that Iran bore a heavy responsibility for destabilisation of the Middle East and that it had pushed ahead with an unjustified nuclear programme, but he also urged restraint after Israel struck Iran.

item.title: Iran Fires Missiles At Israel In Response To Attacks

media:content.media:description: Explosions were heard over Tel Aviv and Jerusalem as sirens sounded on Friday night.

item.description: Explosions were heard over Tel Aviv and Jerusalem as sirens sounded on Friday night across Israel following what the country's military spokesman said was the firing of missiles from Iran.
item.content:encoded: Explosions were heard over Tel Aviv and Jerusalem as sirens sounded on Friday night across Israel following what the country's military spokesman said was the firing of missiles from Iran.

item.title: Pizza Delivery Monitor Alerts To Secret Israel Attack

media:content.media:description: According to Viral X account,Pizza joints near Pentagon got busy before Tehran first reported explosions

item.description: The timing of Israel's plan to attack Iran was top secret. But Washington pizza delivery trackers guessed something was up before the first bombs fell.
item.content:encoded: The timing of Israel's plan to attack Iran was top secret. But Washington pizza delivery trackers guessed something was up before the first bombs fell.

item.title: Israel Attacks Iran News LIVE: Israel Strikes Iran Again, Less Than 24 Hours After Destroying Nuclear Sites

media:content.media:description: Israel, meanwhile, declared a state of emergency after attack on Iran

item.description: Israel Attacks Iran Live Updates: A new explosion was heard at a key uranium enrichment site in central Iran on Friday morning, hours after Israel launched unprecedented air strikes against the Islamic Republic's nuclear programme.
item.content:encoded: Israel Attacks Iran Live Updates: A new explosion was heard at a key uranium enrichment site in central Iran on Friday morning, hours after Israel launched unprecedented air strikes against the Islamic Republic's nuclear programme.

item.title: Not Concerned About War, Gave Iran 60 Days, Today's 61st: Trump Backs Israel

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump said he is "not concerned" about a regional war breaking out in the Middle East

item.description: Donald Trump said on Friday that he is "not concerned" about a regional war breaking out after Israel targeted and destroyed Iran's military and nuclear sites, while also killing its top nuclear scientists and commanders.
item.content:encoded: Donald Trump said on Friday that he is "not concerned" about a regional war breaking out after Israel targeted and destroyed Iran's military and nuclear sites, while also killing its top nuclear scientists and commanders.

item.title: Two Jailed For Gold Toilet Heist At Churchill's Birthplace

media:content.media:description: None of the gold has ever been recovered.

item.description: Two men were jailed on Friday for stealing an 18-carat golden toilet that had been on display as an artwork in an exhibition at Winston Churchill's birthplace.
item.content:encoded: Two men were jailed on Friday for stealing an 18-carat golden toilet that had been on display as an artwork in an exhibition at Winston Churchill's birthplace.

item.title: Arrests Of Non Criminal Immigrants Have Risen Eightfold Since Trump Took Office

media:content.media:description: Trump took office in January pledging to deport millions of illegal immigrants in the US.

item.description: The number of people booked into immigration detention who have been charged only with immigration violations has jumped eight-fold since President Donald Trump took office, government data shows, undercutting his anti-crime message.
item.content:encoded: The number of people booked into immigration detention who have been charged only with immigration violations has jumped eight-fold since President Donald Trump took office, government data shows, undercutting his anti-crime message.

item.title: AstraZeneca Inks China AI Research Deal For Chronic Diseases

media:content.media:description: AstraZeneca announced earlier this year plans to invest $2.5 billion in China.

item.description: British drugmaker AstraZeneca unveiled on Friday an AI-assisted research partnership with Chinese counterpart CSPC Pharmaceuticals worth up to $5.3 billion to tackle chronic diseases.
item.content:encoded: British drugmaker AstraZeneca unveiled on Friday an AI-assisted research partnership with Chinese counterpart CSPC Pharmaceuticals worth up to $5.3 billion to tackle chronic diseases.

item.title: Oil Prices Surge Amid Fears of Iran-Israel Escalation

media:content.media:description: Israel's strikes appeared to have avoided Iranian oil facilities.

item.description: Oil prices risk rocketing further should crude supplies become disrupted from a widening Middle East conflict after Israel struck military and nuclear facilities in Iran, analysts said Friday.
item.content:encoded: Oil prices risk rocketing further should crude supplies become disrupted from a widening Middle East conflict after Israel struck military and nuclear facilities in Iran, analysts said Friday.

item.title: Goal To End AIDS By 2030 "More Off-Track" After Trump Cuts: UNAIDS Head

media:content.media:description: UNAIDS Executive Director said less funding could mean we go more and more offtrack.

item.description: Donald Trump's cuts to HIV/AIDS programmes will further derail an already faltering plan to end the disease as a public health threat by 2030, UNAIDS Executive Director Winnie Byanyima said on Friday.
item.content:encoded: Donald Trump's cuts to HIV/AIDS programmes will further derail an already faltering plan to end the disease as a public health threat by 2030, UNAIDS Executive Director Winnie Byanyima said on Friday.

item.title: Trump's Tax Bill Draws Rural Backlash Over Proposed Medicaid Reductions

media:content.media:description: National Rural Health Association said the bill could force providers to cut services or close.

item.description: Rural hospitals are sounding the alarm over proposed healthcare cuts in President Donald Trump's sweeping tax-cut and spending package, warning the changes could force them to scale back services or close their doors.
item.content:encoded: Rural hospitals are sounding the alarm over proposed healthcare cuts in President Donald Trump's sweeping tax-cut and spending package, warning the changes could force them to scale back services or close their doors.

item.title: After Years Of Waiting, Israel's Netanyahu Finally Makes His Move On Iran

media:content.media:description: Netanyahu points to a red line on the graphic of a bomb representing Iran's nuclear programme

item.description: Iran once ridiculed Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu as the boy who cried wolf for his constant public warnings about Tehran's nuclear programme, and his repeated threats to shut it down, one way or another.
item.content:encoded: Iran once ridiculed Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu as the boy who cried wolf for his constant public warnings about Tehran's nuclear programme, and his repeated threats to shut it down, one way or another.
